subsection.p: The goal of this tutorial is to explain the different steps in order to use the DbPage. Let's take a simple SQL structure of some project attributes in a table.

The aim of the report is to publish online the sum of the budgets allocated to each project manager.. The SQL query to obtain the values is given below.
SELECT project_manager,SUM(project_budget) FROM project GROUP BY project_manager

subsection.name: The Dbpage from a file
subsection.p:
The attributes of a dbpage are defined in a file which is named pour nom
"mydbpage.properties" and which is found in "WEB-INF/plugins/dbpage".

tr.td: Name of the dbpage who is used in the request URL: Portal.jsp?page=dbpage&dbpage=dbpage_name .
Name of the page which will be title in the web browser and the navigation tree.
Number of sections defined for the dbpage.

The section types provided are declared in the "/WEB-INF/conf/plugins/dbpage.properties" file.
The base type are "form and "table"
Relative path of the Html template from "WEB-INF/plugins/dbpage/".

For a table section, the field to be defined in the template is the list of titles of the column of the table for the sql result. For the "form" section,the field defines the bookmarks from the template to be substituted by order of the columns in the sql query.
SQL Query which will fill the table.
Connection pool. The default value is that used by the plugin but can be changed.
The rendering of the section is done when the authenticated user has sufficient right defined by the role variable.

subsection.name: The database management of the dbpage
subsection.p: This mode has user interfaces to complete the details used to access the different databases for each section. The function can be accessed by the link "Management of DbPages". The attributes are the same but the templates are stored on the web application. And the SQL query is verified before stored, this reduces runtime errors.
